artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sasaki Toyokichi; Carver: Watanabe Yatarō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 493; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheet; standing man at center wearing armor and undergarment with khaki ground and green and white foliage patterning; crouching woman with face only partially visible through garments covering her, holding a black drum with red cord; garments around woman and white with tan foliage, tan with circle and star pattern and green with white squares; crouching man at right wearing armor and grey garment with green patterning; waterfall at right; falling snow, with snow in mountains and on trees at left and right
dimension: 14 1/2 × 9 3/4 in. (36.83 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 彫弥太 {hori Yata}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Picture of Shizuka and Hangan Parting at Yoshino
